questions: Why are brown algae brown?
answers: The pigments responsible for brown colour are xanthophyll and fucoxanthin.

questions: Name the substance that fixes the brown algae to the substrate.  (KVS2017)
answers: Algin.

questions: What type of organisms have been included in kingdom plantae?
answers: Kingdom plantae includes all the multicellular, photosynthetic producers of the biosphere,

questions: What are algae?
answers: Algae are plants with a thallus body which is not divided into root, stem and leaves. They are generally autotrophs,

questions: Name a red algae inhabiting fresh water.
answers: Batrachospermum,

questions: Which pigments are responsible for red colour of red algae?
answers: The pigments responsible for red colour of red algae are phycobilins, phycoerythrin and phycocyanin.

questions: Name a unicellular algae and the algae which reproduce sexually by conjugation.
answers: Unicellular algae is Chlamydomonas. Algae that reproduce sexually by conjugation is Spirogyra.

questions: When palmella stage is formed in algae?
answers: Palmella stage is formed in response to desiccation condition and toxic salts.

questions: Name an algae which is used in laboratory culture media.
answers: Gelidium ‚Äì Agar.

questions: Name a parasitic red alga and an alga responsible for the disease red rust of tea and coffee plant.
answers: Parasitic red alga ‚Äì Harocyella. Alga responsible for red rust of tea and coffee ‚Äì Cephaleuros.

questions: why are some bryophytes called liverworts?
answers: Some bryophytes are called as liverworts because their gametophyte resembles with liver lobes.

questions: What are rhizoids?
answers: Rhizoids are slender, unicellular or multicellular hair like structures which penetrate in the moist soil and absorbs the water for the plants.

questions: Name the bryophyte in which sporogonium is embedded in the thallus.
answers: Riccia.

questions: Define protonema stage.
answers: A juvenile autotrophic filamentous stage of mosses is called protonema.

questions: What are tracheophytes?
answers: Tracheophytes are the plants having vascular tissues.

questions: Which types of plants are kept under the division thallophyta?
answers: They include primitive forms of plant life showing a simple plant body.

questions: What are phycocolloids?
answers: Mucopolysaceharides over the cellulosic cell wall of brown algae such as agar, carrageenin, alginates etc, are known as phycocollolds.

questions: Name scedless vascular plants.
answers: Pteridophytes.

questions: Define a sporophylI.
answers: Leaves which bear spores on them are called as sporophylIs.

questions: Which group of plants is called vascular cryptogams?
answers: Pterdophytes are called as vascular cryptogams.

questions: Name the food stored in red alga.
answers: The stored food in red alga is Floridean starch

questions: From which algae does bromine is obtained?
answers: Bromine is obtained from Rhodomela.

questions: What is apophysis?
answers: Lower part of moss capsule is known asapophysis,

questions: What is Algin?
answers: Algin is a kind of complex sugar found in brown algae.

questions: Write the economic importance of moss plant.
answers: The moss Sphagnum absorbs water and is theretor used for keeping cut plant parts moist.

questions: Name the female sex organ in red algae.
answers: Carpogonium is the female sex organ in red alge.

questions: What is peristome?
answers: A structure consisting of curved teeth in the capsule of Funaria is termed as peristome.

questions: What is rhizome?
answers: In fems, the underground stem is called as rhizome.

questions: What are cone bearing plants called?
answers: The cone bearing plants are called Gymnosperm.

questions: What is an endosperm?
answers: A tissue which stores food in seeds and surrounds the embryo is known as endosperm.

questions: Name one tallest and one smallest angiosperm.
answers: (i) Tallest angiosperm - Eucalyptus regnans. (ii) Smallest angiosperm- Wolffia arrhiza.

questions: What do you understand by siphonogamy?
answers: It is a mode of pollination in which pollen tubes develop to facilitate the passage of male cells to eggs.

questions: What is an ovule?
answers: Ovule is an integumented megasporangium. It forms female gametophyte internally and after fertilization ripens to form a seed.

questions: What are epiphytes?
answers: A plant which grows on other plant but synthesizes its own food are termed as epiphytes.

questions: What is polyembryony?
answers: The phenomenon of occurrence of several embryos within one seed is known as polyembryony. ùëí. ùëî., citrus fruits.

questions: Give an example of unisexual angiospermic plant.
answers: (i) Mirabilis jalapa (4' O clock plant) (i) Cucurbita maxima (Kaddu).

questions: Name the different whorls of a flower.
answers: The different whorls of a flower are: (i) Calyx  (ii) Corolla  (iii) Androecium  (iv) Gynoecium

questions: Name a wild gymnosperm.
answers: Cycas circinalis.

questions: What term is used for life cycle having diploid dominant phase and gametophytic phase represented by few cells? (KVS 2013)
answers: Diplontic life cycle.
